publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland's hill and island communities.
S1M-1119 Aberdeen Angus Cattle (lodged on 14 August 2000) Irene McGugan*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland's hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan
S1M-1119 Aberdeen Angus Cattle (lodged on 14 August 2000) Alex Neil*, Richard Lochhead*

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland's hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-1119 Aberdeen Angus Cattle (lodged on 14 August 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-1119 Aberdeen Angus Cattle (lodged on 14 August 2000) Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1119 Aberdeen Angus Cattle (lodged on 14 August 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland's hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland’s hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland’s hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1119 Aberdeen Angus Cattle (lodged on 14 August 2000) Ben Wallace*
S1M-1119 Aberdeen Angus Cattle (lodged on 14 August 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland’s hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan, Ben Wallace, Mr Kenneth Gibson

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland’s hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan, Ben Wallace, Mr Kenneth Gibson

S1M-1119 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Angus Cattle—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review urgently its decision to exclude the hardy Aberdeen Angus breed of cattle from support payments for less favoured areas and recognises the traditional and distinctive role played by Aberdeen Angus breeders in suckler cow production in Scotland’s hill and island communities. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan, Ben Wallace, Mr Kenneth Gibson
